headline: Easiest Pot Roast Ever
description: Make the best pot roast with this easy slow cooker recipe! The roast cooks on top of vegetables, resulting in tender meat and veggies for a comforting meal.

video.description: Easy one pot meal that has delicious results!
video.name: Easiest Pot Roast Ever

name: Easiest Pot Roast Ever

recipeInstructions.text: Cut potatoes, onions, and celery into fairly large chunks; place in the bottom of a slow cooker along with baby carrots. Place roast on top of vegetables. Place 3 bouillon cubes randomly on top of the roast and pour in 1/2 cup water.
Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours or on High for 4 to 5 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the roast should read 145 degrees F (65 degrees C).
Transfer roast to a platter. Remove vegetables using a slotted spoon and arrange them around the roast.

review.reviewBody: Excellent concise steps to make a classic delicious roast!
I used a larger roast and cooked it on low for 8 hours. Came out great.
Super easy just by the recipe. Cooked only on low setting for 8 hours and it just falls apart. Best leftover roast beef sandwiches for next couple days.
"AWESOME" and easy to make....I give it 5 stars!!!! ♥️

I've cooked my mom's recipe for years and pretty close to this one. Slow cooker makes the meat fall apart tender. Can do this in a pressure cooker but I've still been playing with times. I recommend adding a bay leaf or two. And I also use Lipton Beefy onion packet with french onion soup and can of beef consomme. But if never made,then follow instructions first then play with recipe. Longer in slow cooker better it gets l. Stagger potato and carrot. Carrot last or get mushy.

The only thing wrong is the searing. You absolutely must sear meat before you roast it. It makes it more flavorful but you also don't need bullion. Bullion being like 90% salt. Sear any meat with salt pepper garlic just to brown outside. Then put in with veggies and just a touch of water. When done you will have a beautiful broth. Red wine is also good but you add it towards the end.
Loved it.
Yummy!!! I added Guinness beer and chicken broth instead. Also added Brussel sprouts and mushrooms. It was amazing!!!
Simple is best. And this is simple.

I used a lean, boneless beef shoulder roast, browned first on stove top, added a tbsp of Worcestershire sauce, 2 tsp of chopped garlic, and a tsp of dried basil. Added 3 cups of bone beef broth and the boullion with the water. Browning first does take away from being easy, but it's a step I've learned to take for best flavor, especially with a leaner cut of meat. The seasonings are an easy add in. And, we like a lot of gravy, so added extra liquid. Cooked on high for 3 hours, low for another 3. Yum!

I agree with most everyone else but had to laugh at Shanden27. Basically my dear, you made Boeuf Bourgione, with the wine and rosemary and such, which though delicious, isn't quite the same as pot roast. Sorry you only gave it 3 stars tho - because this is really quite delicious and a family not only will love it, but it will be somewhat reminiscent of our mother's or grandmother's Sunday roast.
It’s very similar to my moms Recipe. This one however doesn’t tell you when to put carrots in..I put mine in the last hour so they aren’t mushy.. but have no clue what they recommend for this one..

It was good but I kicked it up a notch. Eliminated celery and put in a small bag of frozen peas. I used red potatoes. No bullion cubes. I also put McCormack slow cooker pot roast seasoning in a cup and a half of white zin wine. Mixed it, tossed it in and cooked for 6 1/2 hours on low. Delicious.

I make this recipe often but with a twist. I add red pepper flakes and Tabasco a couple drops. A can of diced tomatoes and beef stock not water. I also brown/sear the roast prior to putting it in the Slow Cooker. Hot Buttered Biscuits and the fam loves it!
You want complex seasoning and terrific gravy? Add about 1cup of crumbled ginger cookies. Thickens the sauce and enhances the flavor. So easy!
First time using this recipe, had to remove onion due to allergies, Veggies were tender, roast was falling apart. 6 hours on low Absolutely perfect.

this was fantastic, Cooked about 7 hours, Meat was tender, juicy and very flavorful. vegetables came out perfect. 
This was a home run dinner!

Worst recipe ever! I’ll never make it again. I had mine in on high for 6 hours, the meat is still tough as can be and still pink, I can’t even cut it! My potatoes and everything are all mush but the meat is half raw! After googling it I found out the meat needs to be on the bottom of the crock pot and it needs to cook on low for 10 hours never on high!
It needs more flavor! I will be trying again but using more seasoning this time!
Used a moose roast. Very tender and tasty but next time I will thicken the juice to make a gravy.

I loved it!! It was very tasty. There wasn’t much juice left in the pot so I added bouillon and water. Scraping the good stuff off the bottom, added a little corn starch and made a light gravy. My 12 year old grandson loved it!!!! Win!!
was ok

I made a 2 lb chuck roast on the high setting and it was fall-apart fork tender after 4 hours. The flavor was definitely lacking, even though I tweaked it and added my own seasonings as I had no bullion cubes. I substituted the water for beef broth. I'd give it 5 stars just because of how divine the meat came out, I've tried other recipes and have always had a problem with the meat being overdone. Not this one. Will make again and keep experimenting with the spices.
It was highly enjoyable. Took the long route of 8 hours on low. Added more vegetables than called for. 5 stars for easy.
Easy peasy and VERY delicious! Our family favorite.

I'm giving this a 5 because I love how it is both a simple and effective recipe. It is easy to modify to your taste (and worth modifying to add some taste).

I used a 2.5 lb roast. I cooked it on high for 4 hours using slow cooker mode in an instant pot (I was in a pinch). 

It turned out great, though the meat was a bit tough due to my very short cooking time; same thing for the vegetables. 

I used the instant pot high pressure for 5 minutes more - this solved the overly firm vegetable problem.

After shredding the meat I added it back to the pot to hang in the juices, the meat was amazing after that!... still recommending a longer cook time if possible though.

The recipe lacks flavor, and I think that is pretty obvious in the ingredient list... To give this more of a german flare, I added mustard and sliced up some small whole dill pickles. I highly recommend this! However, if you season with just salt and pepper, I'm sure that will satisfy those with a simple palate.
Super easy and tastes great. The kids even loved it. Did not fry out at all!
Followed this recipe to the letter. The results were very disappointing. No flavor, meat was tough. Smelled fabulous while cooking but disappointing results.
Very easy recipe and like others, I doctored it up with some fresh garlic and herbs. Last 15 minutes I threw in a can of mushrooms and the juice added to the gravy. This is a standby recipe forever.

I don't know if it's my slow cooker or what went wrong but I followed this recipe except for using a can of beef broth instead of the cubes & it was horrible. The meat (a chuck roast) was burned from not sitting all the way into the broth (I guess) and most of the potatoes were done, but the carrots and some of the celery weren't. I didn't know about the carrots & celery until I took all the veggies out of the crockpot to make gravy. I ended up wasting a check roast! I can salvage the veggies but will have to eat them for dinner several nights in a row, since I live alone or make some soup. My crockpot is fairly new but this is the second time I've put a roast in it and had it burn. I hate to give bad reviews, but if I try it again, I'll get a new crockpot first!
No changes needed. Best ever

Perfect roast recipe. I like to put a lot of celery, carrots, onions and potatoes in the pot. This recipe is good for a Crockpot or pressure cooker. We don't like to cover up the flavor of the meat and vegetables with garlic or a lot of other seasoning. This is how we love our roast!

Tried to stay with the recip, but didn't have any celery on hand so I just added celery salt. Even though it didn't say salt and pepper the salt, I did since I believe it had to have been left off by mistake or just assumed. I used a Chuck roast and it was bigger than called for so I cooked 6 hrs on low and 2 hrs on high. The last 2 hrs I did take the vegs out and just left the meat. I also added some cornstarch to the gravy just to thicken up just a bit. Had good flavor.

Just a couple of suggestions. I like to use Better Than Bouillon instead of cubes, as it provides much more flavor. I also pour Kitchen Bouquet over the meat before putting the cover on. You will have a dark brown, beautiful roast and nice, dark gravy.
I added and envelope of onion soup mix. Yummy

Made this tonight! Very good! I didn't have bullion so I used dry onion soup mix. I used a round roast but I think a chuck roast might have been a better choice. However, one of the things I love about crock pots is that they make cheaper cuts of meat taste great.

This is a good basic recipe. The only problem was that the cut of beef was not specified. If you used a lean cut, it ended up too dry. You need to use a fatty cut like chuck roast for a slow, low temp cooking. Makes all the difference--ask your butcher for recommendations.
I didnt have time to cook it on low. So I had to cook on high and while it tasted good and everything, wasn't tender enough.
I haven't made it yet.

The whole family loved and and my 14 month old got to eat the veggies out of the left overs too. The meat tasted amazing but thw potatos and carrots were a bit bland. I just added salt on my plate to the veggies and not the meat

Ok, this is one of my favorite wintertime meals. It turns out so good that I usually eat until I hurt. I have a few changes to my potroast reciepe. First I use either a london broil top round roast or a boneless sirloin tip roast both around 2.5 pounds each. By the way, I do 2 of them in seperate crock pots because 1 is never enough lol. In each crock pot along with the meat goes 3 pounds of carrotts, not baby carrotts, peeled and sliced in 1 inch pieces, and half a 5 pound bag of sweet onions, peeled and quartered. The onions and carrotts make the meal. Also add one packet of lipton beefy onion soup. Just put in a bowl with hot water to mix it up and dump it on top. Add enough beef broth or beef bouillon mixed with hot water to cover the roast in the crock pot. If only using bouillon, usually 3 cubes will do it. Put the roast on top of a layer of carrotts and onions, add all ingredients, salt and pepper the roast and cook on low for 9 hours. The meat will melt in your mouth and the carrotts and onions are incredible. Make some garlic mashed potatoes along with the meal and don't forget to save the broth and leftover carrotts and onions for making egg noodles.
Awesome, robust, hearty, great for a nice Winter weekend dish. Thank you

This is the best roast I ever made! I have always roasted them in the oven but this was by far the tenderest and most flavourful. I did make a couple of changes. I omitted the potatoes in the crock pot and made mashed potatoes at the end. I rubbed in salt, pepper and sprinkled some flour on the roast and seared it for about 4 min. on each side. I wanted to make gravy and thought the flour on the roast would make it a little thicker before I I also used the corn starch and water after I poured out the liquid . I deglazed the pan with red wine and pored that in the crockpot. I had a 3 lb. roast and slow cooked it for approx. 6 hrs. Even though I made those changes it was the best roast ever. Thank you for a great recipe.

I tried this recipe having used my slow cooker a few times already. After about 3 hours on high my 2.5lb roast was almost over cooked and the veggies were still kind of raw (edible but crunchy). I ended up taking the meat out and leaving the veggies in on low for another hour or so and they turned out okay. Not sure if I did something wrong or if the recipe needs tweaking. Will probably try again.
Super easy to throw together before leaving to work. Added a little more seasoning and used beef broth for water. Will make again.
Added a bay leaf & used 3/4 cup beef broth as suggested.
very easy simple and very good tasting

Used a crock pot for the first time. Had the steak, carrots, potatoes, salt, pepper, onion powder, and water. Cooked on High for 5 hours. It came out alright. Might add beef broth next time for extra flavor.

EXCELLENT!
Tender, Juicy, and a very hearty meal.
This is the most perfect basic Slow~Cooker pot roast. All we taste is a nice, trûely wonderful beef flavour. If you want something basic, simple, soulful and delicious. (Not overly seasoned or a wierd type flavour). This is your meal. 
Easy to make and such a warm, cozy comfort food. Makes great leftovers for the week. If there is any! LoL.
Getting ready to make this for the 2nd time. The first time,my Wife said "it's the best pot roast I've ever eaten!"
Foolproof easy recipe, but I think it needed something extra. Next time I thing I will stuff the Roast with garlic before cooking.
Great flavors and easy to make but watch cooking times. Made without the veggies and served with mashed potatoes. This ones a keeper.

Sooo easy!! If you want to mix in more stuff is okay, but is just good just as it is. My only comment would be on the cooking time, I had to leave the roast an hour more than the recipe says, but I'm sure it was my slow cooker's heat. Family adored it. Thank you for sharing, maybe next time I'll do it as some of the reviewers suggested, you know, to mix things up :P
Getting everything ready was the hardest part, too about 20 minutes (not a chef), then it coooked until done. It was delicious.
Made some of the suggested seasoning changes, suggested cooking time was good.
First time using a crock pot and this was so easy! I added some spices to it following some other reviews and it was delicious. It does cook faster if you don't put in as many ingredients.

I used an electric skillet and followed the directions however, after 3 hours on simmer, it wasn't done. I put everything in the slow cooker, added 1 cup of water and turned it to low and went to bed. The meat was perfect in the morning however I had to throw the vegetables out because the were mushy and greasy. I took the meet for lunch.
SO easy, the whole family loved it.

I made this today and it was SO amazing!! I did make a couple of changes, I use 2 cups of water so I could have more juice, added some canned mushrooms, and I also added one package of Lipton's dry onion mushroom soup mix. I made some spiral pasta and put the pot roast over it... It was so yummy!! Thank you so much!
No celery, could use a wee bit of garlic, whas this here sauce, or other spices. Used less water

Made this twice. First time made as written except used beef broth instead of bouillon/water because that's what I had. Liked it, but kind of bland (that's why 4 stars). Made again with some easy changes and thought it was much better. As others suggested, used a fair amount of salt, pepper, garlic powder on meat as well as a bay leaf and minced garlic with the beef broth. Didn't use the potatoes because I made mashed potatoes and used the juice to make a gravy, but if I didn't have time for that would definitely throw them in with the veggies. A few simple changes made a huge difference and my family loved it. Hard to find an easy pot roast recipe that doesn't use packets for seasoning.
It was tasteless.

Have a rule of thumb where we make it exactly to recipe first.. and this one was amazing!!! Left everything in the slow cooker until right before serving and it was amazing!!! The vegetables were PERFECT!
Stringy and over cooked. I won't make it again.
This was easy to make and tasted great. Considering this was my first time making pot roast it turned out amazingly

Easy and delicious. I had a small roast, about two pounds. Like others, I found my cooking time a little shorter, closer to 6 hours on low. I also added a little more spice - salt, pepper, Cayenne, garlic on the meat. Last hour I added a few leftovers vegetables - corn and asparagus.

Awesome roast. Mine only needed 4 hours.
Could use more spices though and I plan on seasoning mine more the next time. :)

Great recipe for taste and ease. I used parsnips instead of potato, two cans of beef broth instead of the cubes. Got an Black Angus beef roast on sale (4 lbs). After 8 hours, it pulled apart. Nice sweetness from the parsnips.
I used 1 can of beef broth and 1/2 cup of red wine for the liquid. Otherwise I made as directed. This was good, but not better or easier than the many other pot roast recipes on this site.
Awful! Bland and dry. If you try it, cut the veggies small, increase the cook time, and double the seasoning.

Certainly a recipe I will use over and over. I did however add about 1/4 cup more of water , only used half an onion (because i'm not a huge fan), and before putting the roast in to cook I rubbed it with salt and pepper. It turned out great, but it didn't have all the flavor I wanted. Next time I'll try adding garlic like suggested in the other reviews.
Came out great. Meat was tender and the veggies tasted wonderful after cooking in the juices. My new go to pot roast.
easy to make add your own twist for a savory taste
Very easy and very good. Would definitely use again.
We liked this. Used a little extra vegetables as they would fit in pot. Used bouillon granules. Cooked for 8 hours on low and seemed just a little dry... less next time.
This lacked flavor and the meat was dry. I will not use this recipe again .
Cooked 2.4 lbs for 5 1/2 hours on low. Used 3/4 water and added bay leaf and onion. Tender and delicious.

I've used this method of making pot roast for years now. It guarantees the meat is moist and tender. I do add salt, pepper, garlic powder and bay leaf and brown the roast before putting it in the crock pot. As the newlywed reviewer said, remove the veggies and roast when cooked and use cornstarch to thicken the juice into gravy. Very easy and very good. Don't overthink this recipe and try to turn it into a top chef presentation. Not every recipe needs wine and multiple herbs to be good.

try using regular coke for the liquid-it gives
the roast a sweet taste

Just a bit too bland. But I liked the cooking method, so I used the slow cooker but took the roast uptown by skipping the water and bouillon and simply using low sodium beef broth. I also added some freshly minced garlic, a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, some freshly ground pepper and a bit of salt and a bay leaf. Mmmmm... tender and delicious! When the roast was done, I thickened the sauce with a bit of corn starch and leftover beef broth and made a lovely gravy.

I've made lots of roasts this way, but omit thev3 cubes beef bouillon, because of the salt, and ADD beef stock or beef broth instead, with garlic instead...kind of punches up the flavor a bit, because of omitting the 3 cubes of beef bouillon, and put it on low for about 6 hrs too! ;) yes, the can go on for the time in this recipe, but you also can!

This is a great roast recipe , but to those that have never used it try adding some kitchen bouquet its something I've always used in my roasts and gravies , because my Mom did . And it truly is a secret ingredient.

Certainly an easy recipe. After reading reviews about cooking time and seasoning I have a few comments. 
 Try browning the roast first in a hot pan with a little oil. Then season with salt and pepper. You can also add garlic and other herbs you like. I prefer to use tyme.
 If you like more salt and seasoning, I add an onion soup mix poured over the roast. The bigger your roast, the more seasoning it needs.
 Finally on the cooking time, the longer it cooks the more it will pull apart and shred. If you prefer to slice it, you can remove it when still firm to touch. 
 We always let ours cook slowly and for a long time. Pull it apart and lightly chop. Then back in crock pot with all the veggies and juices. 

Thanks and good luck!

This is basically the recipe I've used for years and you can't beat it. For those of you thinking there should be more flavor try adding 1/2 to 1 packet of Lipton Onion Soup mix. I usually use beef broth instead of bouillon cubes. The juices make an excellent gravy. What really bothers me on these roast beef recipes is it is rarely mentioned which cut of beef is used. I stick with a chuck roast as I can depend on it being fall apart tender and having a rich flavor. I've never had much luck with rump roasts (not sure what they call them today) and don't know how that would work in a recipe like this even though it's in slow cooker.
I changed the water to root beer. Gave it a nice sweet flavor. Super tender!!
Very good & easy to make. I followed other raters' advice and seasoned, floured & browned the meat before slow cooking it. It was delicious! I will definitely be making this again.
I'm made this for a house warming Dinner for my parents to come see my new house. My husband loved it as well as my parents. I put a little more water in mine but still so simple and so delicious!
My whole family loved this recipe. The only thing I did different was omit the celery and add an extra onion. Thanks for sharing!
Loved the bouillon in this, but I agree to season the meat more and so I did with house seasoning. I also made a luscious gravy with the drippings. I was asked to make this again soon.
Really easy and really good! Next time, I'll use beef broth instead of water.

This is a terrific, easy-to-do recipe for pot roast. I love the simplicity, particularly for my college-age daughters and parents who are rushing out the door to work in the morning. While I appreciate the many "reviews" of the recipe, in fact most folks are completely rewriting the recipe. One of the "most helpful critical reviews" adds nine additional ingredients! That's not a review, that's another recipe altogether! Submit it as such, please!

This was very easy, and my husband liked it a lot. Rubbed the roast with salt, pepper, garlic powder and basil and added a bay leaf to the crock pot. Used beef broth (10 oz) and no water, and thickened the liquid with a flour water slurry while the roast rested. Thanks!
Very good starter recipe. I too added some spices, once using an onion soup packet and the other time I just threw in what sounded good from the spice rack. Each time...Delish!
This really is super easy and delicious.
Family found it very bland, however, the meat was very tender and juicy. Will not make again.
Browned Chuck Roast. Added 1/2 cup red wine, can of beef broth and a can of cream of roasted garlic and mushroom soup. Omitted the cubes/water. Cooked high for 3 hours and low for 2.

Because I was having guests over for dinner after church I prepared the vegetables and meat the the night before. I used 6 large red potatoes, 3 small-medium onions, some celery for flavor, a few more carrots, and floured and browned the roast. After placing the vegetables and roast in the crockpot I covered the meat with Montreal seasoning and Lipton's onion soup mix. After pouring in the beef broth, I then placed the crock in the refrigerator. At 5:45 a.m. I turned the crockpot on high for 3 1/2 hours then turned it to low when I walked out the door. Returning home at 12:45, I put a bag of frozen peas in a casserole dish and microwaved it for 8-10 minutes. Dinner is served! The key to a tender roast is choosing one with lots of marbling. Cooking it on low for 8 hours would have been my preference but I was a bit short on time. Thanks to all who made suggestions so I could adapt the basic recipe using a few things already in the cupboard. I have made this before with the original recipe and found it tasty and tender as well.
Love love LOVE this roast!! I use it every time I do roast. Very simple and yummy!!

My husband loved this dinner!!! The meat came out so tender and juicy. I did tweak the recipe just a tad to our own taste. I used about 2blsp cornstarch added about 1 and half cup of water. browned meat with a 2splashes of red wine for a few min then place it in the bottom poured water mix over it added some spices to our taste some worchester sauce,chili flakes,thyme,oregano,basil,chili pepper. layered potatoes,and carrots on top (didn't have celery added sliced pepper) and cooked on low for 8hrs. Wonderful and easy recipe would highly recommend.
